definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
habit becomes nature (idiom); get used to something and it seems inevitable/second nature

sentences.english: This grave matron had several sorts of practice.
sentences.chinese: 這位假正經的婦人有好幾種慣做的事情。

sentences.english: The chairman presided over the meeting with his usual tact and urbanity.
sentences.chinese: 主席以他慣有的機智和文雅主持會議。

sentences.english: The little girl passed up crabs, saying that they did not agree with her.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩不願意喫螃蟹，說她喫不慣。

sentences.english: Are you used to the food here ?
sentences.chinese: 你喫得慣這裏的飯菜嗎？

sentences.english: I am a vulgar person, the skeleton used to dissolute , can't change also don't want to change.
sentences.chinese: 我是一個俗人，形骸放浪慣了，改不了也不想改。

sentences.english: Children should be disciplined and not indulged.
You Do not suspicious, he is accustomed to the parsimonious .
sentences.chinese: 你別多心，他就是儉省慣了的。

sentences.english: This is routinely used to block any demonstration that citizens have the temerity to propose.
sentences.chinese: 這個程序是慣有的組織公民魯莽提議的範例。

sentences.english: A: Are you used to the food here? B: Well, to be honest with you.
sentences.chinese: 你喫得慣這兒的飯菜嗎？

sentences.english: What's the difference between pirate and "overlord meal" ?
sentences.chinese: 用慣了盜版與喫慣了“霸王餐”有什麼不一樣嗎？

sentences.english: A wild ass used to the wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure;
sentences.chinese: 你是野驢，慣在曠野，欲心發動就吸風。

sentences.english: He is a playboy, and spends money hand-over-fist.
sentences.chinese: 他是個花花公子，花起錢來大手大腳慣了。

sentences.english: Are you used to the (Chinese)food here ?
sentences.chinese: 你喫得慣這兒的飯菜麼？

sentences.english: Are you used to eating rice?
I know you're used to loosed-goosey.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你們過去散漫慣了。
